_meta.description: Canonical source list for Youth Career Events. These URLs are the approved sources from which events are discovered and added to the seed data.
_meta.usage: Check these sources periodically to find new events for prisma/seed-career-events.ts

sources.name: Ta Utdanning — Student Fairs
sources.description: Norway's largest education fair organizer. Runs fairs in 8 cities: Oslo, Bergen, Trondheim, Stavanger, Kristiansand, Sandefjord, Tromsø, Ålesund. Targets upper secondary and middle school students. ~12,000 visitors at the Oslo fair alone.
sources.notes: JS-rendered site — details found via web search. Hours typically 09:00-14:00. Free admission.

sources.name: EducationFair.net — Norway Education Fairs
sources.description: Education fair directory and booking platform. Lists study fairs and education expos across Norway. Useful for discovering fairs from multiple organizers.
sources.notes: JS-rendered site, content loads dynamically. Use as a discovery tool, then verify individual events on their official sites.

sources.name: Oslo Student Hub — OsloMet Career Fair
sources.description: Annual career fair at OsloMet (Oslo Metropolitan University) organized by Oslo Student Hub in partnership with Oslo Technical Society (OTS). Connects engineering, tech, and data students with leading Norwegian companies.
sources.notes: Wix-based site. Check back for 2026 dates. Previous editions held in autumn.

sources.name: BI Karrieredagene (Career Days)
sources.description: One of Scandinavia's largest career events at BI Norwegian Business School. ~100 companies annually. Includes lectures from business leaders, career development courses, internship info sessions, and networking banquet. Run by Student Union volunteers.
sources.notes: Official event site is karrieredagene.no (Wix). BI page has general info. Bergen campus also has separate career days via biso.no.

sources.name: ISFiT — International Student Festival in Trondheim
sources.description: World's largest student festival with thematic emphasis. ~450 international students. 10-day festival every two years since 1990. Created by 400 volunteers. Includes debates, workshops, cultural events, and career networking.
sources.notes: 2027 theme: 'Changing Winds'. No 2026 edition (biennial). Official site isfit.org, also samfundet.no/en/isfit.

sources.name: UiO Pro Bono Career Event
sources.description: Career event at University of Oslo for students interested in pro bono legal and social impact work. Panel discussions with lawyers, corporate social impact leaders, and student legal aid organizations. Followed by networking reception.
sources.notes: Small/niche event. Registration via Nettskjema. Conducted in English. Good for law/social science students.

sources.name: Digital Life Norway — Research School Events
sources.description: Events from the Centre for Digital Life Norway research school. Webinars, workshops, PhD courses, and annual conference. Topics include AI, genetics, computational biology, and scientific communication.
sources.schedule: Year-round (30+ events in 2025, no 2026 events listed yet)
sources.notes: Primarily aimed at PhD/postdoc level. Some webinars open to alumni. Physical events reserved for active members. Travel grants available.

sources.name: All International Conference — Youth Events Norway
sources.description: Conference directory listing academic and professional events. Filterable by month, country, and topic. Lists youth conferences, seminars, and workshops in Norway.
sources.notes: JS-rendered directory. Content loads dynamically via AJAX filters. Use as discovery tool.

sources.name: Oslo Kommune — Welcome Events
sources.description: Events organized by the City of Oslo, Oslo Business Region, and Oslopolitan to help newcomers integrate. Includes community meetups, seasonal activities, cultural experiences, professional networking, and language exchanges.
sources.notes: General newcomer events, not youth-specific. Useful for students new to Oslo. Check partner sites for updates.

additionalSources._description: Sources discovered during research that complement the primary list above

careerFairs.name: KarriereDagene NTNU
careerFairs.description: Norway's largest career fair. Companies from all sectors meet NTNU students.

careerFairs.name: Springbrettet Karrieredagen Bergen
careerFairs.description: Vestland's largest career fair. 75+ companies across 2 floors at Grieghallen. Student-organized since 2007.

careerFairs.name: Karrieredagen Stavanger
careerFairs.description: Career fair with festival atmosphere. Networking stands, career coaching, competitions. Free admission.

careerFairs.name: BISO Career Days Bergen
careerFairs.description: BI Student Organization career fair at BI Bergen campus.

careerFairs.name: CHARM — Chalmers Career Fair
careerFairs.description: One of Scandinavia's leading career fairs. Held every February on Chalmers campus.

careerFairs.name: THS Armada — KTH Career Fair
careerFairs.description: Major student career fair at KTH Royal Institute of Technology.

euYouthEvents.name: European Youth Week 2026
euYouthEvents.description: EU-wide youth engagement week. Kick-off at European Parliament with 1,000+ young people. Theme: Solidarity and Fairness. Celebrates 30 years of volunteering in Europe.
euYouthEvents.venue: European Parliament, Brussels (kick-off) + events across Europe

euYouthEvents.name: Arendalsuka 2026
euYouthEvents.description: Norway's largest democracy festival. Youth programme (Arendalsuka Ung) has ~50 events for ages 4-19. ~4,000 children and young people attend.
